channel.title: Question for FoL / FM players here that don't play ToL
channel.description:
hey, i have a question for forumers like myself who don't really play ToL anymore (except under rare circumstances, at least)
do any of you feel that ToL is incredibly bland compared to FoL and FM? after pouring 1,100 hours into ToL over 2 1/2 years, that's how i feel, and why I decided to stop playing ToL, stop helping in the discord, and end my quest for attempting guideship
not sure how many other people feel like this, idk

item.title: Question for FoL / FM players here that don't play ToL
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
Throne of Lies is a 3D online multiplayer game where up to 16 players use their social deduction skills in a modern take on tabletop games like Werewolf/Mafia and set during a time of medieval conflict within a fantasy realm.

The unique Day/Night cycle allows unique encounters with different strategies per phase. During the day, players discuss their findings and accuse players of treason. At night, players use their abilities to occupy, spy on, conspire against and even kill the opposing players. In a game of minority vs majority and where wit is more important than abilities, the good players will accuse and execute the guilty of treason, while the bad guys will manipulate others to turn the good guys against themselves!

While Cult and Unseen players know their allies, members of the Blue Dragon must be suspicious of every other player to ensure that they don’t fall to an evil plot. Even the King is suspect in Throne of Lies , and the enemy’s ability to convert other players to their side means that allegiances are always shifting.

The game concludes when the Blue Dragon faction has disposed of all hostile threats against the kingdom or their enemies have seized control of the Throne of Lies !

Read full topic

item.title: Question for FoL / FM players here that don't play ToL
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
Remember that time I forced a Prince to jail themself as an outed Invoker, stayed alive for multiple days, and lead the town to lynch the Fool (@Hippolytus) instead of me, removing their ability to execute for ten days straight, and then dying as a sacrifice by the Cult Leader, fueling additional kill power on my way out?

I win

item.title: Question for FoL / FM players here that don't play ToL
item.dc:creator: anon97870008
item.description:
Replace into a MM
Try to get yourself lynched… but so obv that they prefer to jail exe me
Using your Assassin to silence Prince
(Get a quickhammer so this silence wasnt even necessary)
Convert a Noble for the sweet doublevote.
We had 4 vs 4 vote parity, but we were faster.

Both doublevote and prince-silence are now removed

item.title: Question for FoL / FM players here that don't play ToL
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
anon97870008:

Tol players can do mechanical stuff Fol players never were capable of (my scum win in Fol 20 is a good example of this, the combination of several complicated mechanics)

I have no idea what this refers to

But I guarantee you I’ve seen “FoL players” and especially FM players do way crazier mechanical plays than whatever this was. There is literally a 0% chance you managed to top all of the mechanical bs and fpsing I’ve seen over the years in one game of FoL of all things.

Read full topic
item.source: Question for FoL / FM players here that don't play ToL

item.title: Question for FoL / FM players here that don't play ToL
item.dc:creator: anon97870008
item.description:
I never said they are right
But it has some truth regardless. Tol players can do mechanical stuff Fol players never were capable of (my scum win in Fol 20 is a good example of this, the combination of several complicated mechanics)
While I was playing 1000 hours Tol already and still needed to learn how to wallpost in Fol… 5 months. On the other side, I had correct scumreads already in my first few fols, I just wasnt able to explain why.
Most players under 100 hours arent using social stuff in tol tho, so its kinda correct

Read full topic
item.source: Question for FoL / FM players here that don't play ToL

item.title: Question for FoL / FM players here that don't play ToL
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
anon97870008:

FM players insult ToL players for not being able to read socially, and ToL players insult FM players for not being able to understand the mechanics

I have never seen an “FM player” unable to grasp ToL mechanics unless they specifically don’t try

Likewise I have never seen a “ToL player” who is, like, incapable of learning to read social cues, and you yourself have stated that once you’ve played 100+ games that most players start focusing more on social cues for their games

I feel like there’s a false dichotomy being drawn here

Read full topic

item.title: Question for FoL / FM players here that don't play ToL
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
anon97870008:

FM people are not bad people - they are just exactly the opposite of normal tol players. They have other interests.

I guarantee you that your view of “normal” ToL players is decidedly not accurate unless you understand that you are definitively not in that category
